definition[0]: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
example[0]: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
example[1]: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
definition[1]: if a job rotates, or if people rotate jobs, they each do a particular job for a particular period of time
example[2]: The chairmanship of the committee rotates annually.
example[3]: Employers may rotate duties to give staff wider experience.
definition[2]: to change the places of things or people, or to change places, especially in a circular direction
example[4]: Rotating the tyres every few months helps them last longer.
definition[3]: to regularly change the crops grown on a piece of land, in order to preserve the quality of the soil
definition[4]: if a job rotates, or if people rotate jobs, they each do the jobs for a fixed period of time, one after the other
example[5]: Within each section of the company, workers are now rotated from job to job regularly.
